DOC.brief_summary: Due to the HBV and HCV infection, about 55% hepatocellular carcinoma patients happened in China. Among them, only 10% patients can be diagnosed in early stage. Sorafenib increased PFS and OS in advanced hepatocellular carcinoma patients with liver function of Child-Pugh class A patients, but the result for Child-Pugh class B patients is unclear.
DOC.brief_title: Sorafenib in Liver Function Impaired Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma
DOC.criteria: pathological or cytological confirmed advanced hepatocellular carcinoma 18 years to 80 years liver function ChildPugh class B BCLC stage B or C estimated life time 2 months or longer previous target therapy allergy to Sorafenib Uncontrolled Bleeding or diarrhea eligible for locoregional treatment
